line_text: What say'st thou to her?

line_text: She's impudent, my lord,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And was a common gamester to the camp.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He does me wrong, my lord; if I were so,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He might have bought me at a common price:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Do not believe him. O, behold this ring,

line_text: Whose high respect and rich validity
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Did lack a parallel; yet for all that

line_text: He gave it to a commoner o' the camp,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: If I be one.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He blushes, and 'tis it:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Of six preceding ancestors, that gem,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Conferr'd by testament to the sequent issue,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Hath it been owed and worn. This is his wife;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: That ring's a thousand proofs.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Methought you said
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: You saw one here in court could witness it.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I did, my lord, but loath am to produce
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: So bad an instrument: his name's Parolles.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I saw the man to-day, if man he be.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Find him, and bring him hither.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: What of him?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He's quoted for a most perfidious slave,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: With all the spots o' the world tax'd and debosh'd;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Whose nature sickens but to speak a truth.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Am I or that or this for what he'll utter,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: That will speak any thing?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: She hath that ring of yours.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I think she has: certain it is I liked her,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And boarded her i' the wanton way of youth:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: She knew her distance and did angle for me,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Madding my eagerness with her restraint,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: As all impediments in fancy's course
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Are motives of more fancy; and, in fine,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Her infinite cunning, with her modern grace,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Subdued me to her rate: she got the ring;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And I had that which any inferior might
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: At market-price have bought.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I must be patient:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: You, that have turn'd off a first so noble wife,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: May justly diet me. I pray you yet;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Since you lack virtue, I will lose a husband;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Send for your ring, I will return it home,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And give me mine again.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I have it not.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: What ring was yours, I pray you?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Sir, much like
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: The same upon your finger.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Know you this ring? this ring was his of late.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And this was it I gave him, being abed.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: The story then goes false, you threw it him
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Out of a casement.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I have spoke the truth.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: My lord, I do confess the ring was hers.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: You boggle shrewdly, every feather stars you.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Is this the man you speak of?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Ay, my lord.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Tell me, sirrah, but tell me true, I charge you,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Not fearing the displeasure of your master,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Which on your just proceeding I'll keep off,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: By him and by this woman here what know you?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: So please your majesty, my master hath been an
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: honourable gentleman: tricks he hath had in him,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: which gentlemen have.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Come, come, to the purpose: did he love this woman?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Faith, sir, he did love her; but how?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: How, I pray you?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He did love her, sir, as a gentleman loves a woman.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: How is that?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He loved her, sir, and loved her not.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: As thou art a knave, and no knave. What an
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: equivocal companion is this!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I am a poor man, and at your majesty's command.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He's a good drum, my lord, but a naughty orator.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Do you know he promised me marriage?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Faith, I know more than I'll speak.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: But wilt thou not speak all thou knowest?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Yes, so please your majesty. I did go between them,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: as I said; but more than that, he loved her: for
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: indeed he was mad for her, and talked of Satan and
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: of Limbo and of Furies and I know not what: yet I
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: was in that credit with them at that time that I
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: knew of their going to bed, and of other motions,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: as promising her marriage, and things which would
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: derive me ill will to speak of; therefore I will not
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: speak what I know.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Thou hast spoken all already, unless thou canst say
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: they are married: but thou art too fine in thy
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: evidence; therefore stand aside.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: This ring, you say, was yours?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Ay, my good lord.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Where did you buy it? or who gave it you?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: It was not given me, nor I did not buy it.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Who lent it you?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: It was not lent me neither.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Where did you find it, then?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I found it not.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: If it were yours by none of all these ways,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: How could you give it him?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I never gave it him.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: This woman's an easy glove, my lord; she goes off
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: and on at pleasure.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: This ring was mine; I gave it his first wife.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: It might be yours or hers, for aught I know.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Take her away; I do not like her now;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: To prison with her: and away with him.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Unless thou tell'st me where thou hadst this ring,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Thou diest within this hour.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I'll never tell you.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Take her away.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I'll put in bail, my liege.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I think thee now some common customer.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: By Jove, if ever I knew man, 'twas you.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Wherefore hast thou accused him all this while?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Because he's guilty, and he is not guilty:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He knows I am no maid, and he'll swear to't;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I'll swear I am a maid, and he knows not.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Great king, I am no strumpet, by my life;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I am either maid, or else this old man's wife.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: She does abuse our ears: to prison with her.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Good mother, fetch my bail. Stay, royal sir:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And he shall surety me. But for this lord,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Who hath abused me, as he knows himself,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: He knows himself my bed he hath defiled;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And at that time he got his wife with child:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And now behold the meaning.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Is there no exorcist
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Beguiles the truer office of mine eyes?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Is't real that I see?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: No, my good lord;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: 'Tis but the shadow of a wife you see,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: The name and not the thing.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Both, both. O, pardon!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: O my good lord, when I was like this maid,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I found you wondrous kind. There is your ring;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And, look you, here's your letter; this it says:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: 'When from my finger you can get this ring
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: And are by me with child,' &c. This is done:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Will you be mine, now you are doubly won?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: If she, my liege, can make me know this clearly,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I'll love her dearly, ever, ever dearly.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: If it appear not plain and prove untrue,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Deadly divorce step between me and you!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: O my dear mother, do I see you living?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Mine eyes smell onions; I shall weep anon:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Good Tom Drum, lend me a handkercher: so,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: I thank thee: wait on me home, I'll make sport with thee:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Let thy courtesies alone, they are scurvy ones.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Let us from point to point this story know,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: To make the even truth in pleasure flow.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: If thou be'st yet a fresh uncropped flower,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Choose thou thy husband, and I'll pay thy dower;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: For I can guess that by thy honest aid
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Thou keep'st a wife herself, thyself a maid.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Of that and all the progress, more or less,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: Resolvedly more leisure shall express:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: All yet seems well; and if it end so meet,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: The bitter past, more welcome is the sweet.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

line_text: The king's a beggar, now the play is done:
scene_title: EPILOGUE

line_text: All is well ended, if this suit be won,
scene_title: EPILOGUE

line_text: That you express content; which we will pay,
scene_title: EPILOGUE

line_text: With strife to please you, day exceeding day:
scene_title: EPILOGUE

line_text: Ours be your patience then, and yours our parts;
scene_title: EPILOGUE

line_text: Your gentle hands lend us, and take our hearts.
scene_title: EPILOGUE
